verses.text: \w The|strong="H1121"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Levi|strong="H3878"\w*: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Eleazar was the father of Phinehas, Phinehas was the father of Abishua,
Abishua was the father of Bukki, Bukki was the father of Uzzi,
Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah, Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth,
Meraioth was the father of Amariah, Amariah was the father of Ahitub,
Ahitub was the father of Zadok, Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz,
Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah, Azariah was the father of Johanan,
Johanan was the father of Azariah, who served as priest in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem,
Azariah was the father of Amariah, Amariah was the father of Ahitub,
Ahitub was the father of Zadok, Zadok was the father of Shallum,
Shallum was the father of Hilkiah, Hilkiah was the father of Azariah,
Azariah was the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak.\f + \fr 6:14 \ft Jehozadak is a variant of Jozadak; also in verse 15; see Ezra 3:2.\f*
Jehozadak went into captivity when the LORD sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
\w The|strong="H5921"\w* sons \w of|strong="H1004"\w* Levi: Gershom,\f + \fr 6:16 \ft Gershom is a variant of Gershon; similarly in verses 17, 20, 43, 62, and 71; see verse 1.\f* Kohath, and Merari.
These are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* clans \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w Levites|strong="H1121"\w* listed according \w to|strong="H1121"\w* their fathers:
Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.
The descendants of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph \f + \fr 6:23 \ft Ebiasaph is a variant of Abiasaph; also in verse 37; see Exodus 6:24.\f* his son, Assir his son,
Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
The descendants of Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth,
Elkanah his son,\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Some Hebrew manuscripts, LXX, and Syriac; most Hebrew manuscripts Elkanah. The sons of Elkanah:\f* Zophai his son, Nahath his son,

Eliab \f + \fr 6:27 \ft Eliab is also called Eliel; see verse 34. Both of these are other names for Elihu; see 1 Samuel 1:1.\f* his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.\f + \fr 6:27 \ft Hebrew; some LXX manuscripts include and Samuel his son; see verses 33–34 and 1 Samuel 1:19–20.\f*

The sons of Samuel: Joel his firstborn and Abijah his second son.\f + \fr 6:28 \ft See Syriac and some LXX manuscripts (also verse 33 and 1 Samuel 8:2); Hebrew The sons of Samuel: the firstborn Vashni, then Abiah.\f*
The descendants of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son. The Temple Musicians

These \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w men|strong="H1121"\w* David put \w in|strong="H1121"\w* charge \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* music \w in|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* house \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* after \w the|strong="H1121"\w* ark rested there.

They ministered \w with|strong="H1121"\w* song before \w the|strong="H1121"\w* tabernacle, \w the|strong="H1121"\w* Tent \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Meeting, until Solomon built \w the|strong="H1121"\w* house \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w in|strong="H1121"\w* Jerusalem. \w And|strong="H1121"\w* they performed \w their|strong="H4847"\w* duties according \w to|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* regulations given \w them|strong="H1121"\w*.

\w These|strong="H3605"\w* \w are|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w men|strong="H3605"\w* \w who|strong="H3605"\w* served, together \w with|strong="H1004"\w* \w their|strong="H3605"\w* sons. From the Kohathites: Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel,\f + \fr 6:34 \ft Eliel is also called Eliab; see verse 27. Both of these are other names for Elihu; see 1 Samuel 1:1.\f* the son of Toah,
the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
Heman’s kinsman was Asaph, who served at his right hand: Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,
the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah,\f + \fr 6:40 \ft Most Hebrew manuscripts; some Hebrew manuscripts, one LXX manuscript, and Syriac Maaseiah\f* the son of Malchijah,
the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
On the left were their kinsmen, the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,
the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi. The Descendants of Aaron

\w Their|strong="H8147"\w* \w fellow|strong="H1121"\w* \w Levites|strong="H1121"\w* \w were|strong="H1121"\w* assigned \w to|strong="H1121"\w* \w every|strong="H4940"\w* kind \w of|strong="H1121"\w* service \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* tabernacle, \w the|strong="H1121"\w* house \w of|strong="H1121"\w* God.

\w But|strong="H3881"\w* Aaron \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w his|strong="H5414"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w did|strong="H3478"\w* \w all|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w work|strong="H5414"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* Most Holy \w Place|strong="H5414"\w*.\f + \fr 6:49 \ft Or the Holy of Holies\f* \w They|strong="H3478"\w* \w presented|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w offerings|strong="H3478"\w* \w on|strong="H5892"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* altar \w of|strong="H1121"\w* burnt offering \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w on|strong="H5892"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* altar \w of|strong="H1121"\w* incense \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w make|strong="H5414"\w* atonement \w for|strong="H1121"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, according \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w all|strong="H5414"\w* \w that|strong="H3478"\w* \w Moses|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* servant \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w God|strong="H5414"\w* \w had|strong="H3478"\w* commanded.
These were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son. Territories for the Levites (Numbers 35:1–8; Joshua 21:1–45)
Now these were the territories assigned to the descendants \w of|strong="H4054"\w* Aaron from the Kohathite clan for their settlements, because the first lot fell to them:
They were given Hebron in the land of Judah and its surrounding pasturelands.
But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.

So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), Libnah,\f + \fr 6:57 \ft As in the parallel text at Joshua 21:13; Hebrew were given the cities of refuge: Hebron, Libnah\f* Jattir, Eshtemoa,
Hilen,\f + \fr 6:58 \ft Some Hebrew Manuscripts; MT Hilez; parallel text at Joshua 21:15 Holon\f* Debir,

Ashan,\f + \fr 6:59 \ft Ashan is a variant of Ain; see Joshua 21:16.\f* Juttah, \f + \fr 6:59 \ft Syriac and the parallel text at Joshua 21:16; MT does not include Juttah,\f* and Beth-shemesh, together with their pasturelands.

And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, \f + \fr 6:60 \ft LXX, Syriac, and parallel text at Joshua 21:17; MT does not include Gibeon,\f* Geba, Alemeth, and Anathoth, together with their pasturelands. So they had thirteen cities in all among their families.
To the rest of the Kohathites, ten cities were allotted from the half-tribe of Manasseh.

\w The|strong="H1121"\w* Gershomites \f + \fr 6:62 \ft Gershomites is a variant of Gershonites; also in verse 71; see 1 Chronicles 23:7.\f*, according \w to|strong="H1121"\w* \w their|strong="H4847"\w* clans, \w were|strong="H1121"\w* allotted thirteen cities \w from|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w tribes|strong="H4294"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* Manasseh \w in|strong="H1121"\w* Bashan.

\w The|strong="H5676"\w* Merarites, according \w to|strong="H3383"\w* their families, \w were|strong="H3383"\w* allotted twelve cities \w from|strong="H4294"\w* \w the|strong="H5676"\w* \w tribes|strong="H4294"\w* \w of|strong="H4294"\w* \w Reuben|strong="H7205"\w*, Gad, \w and|strong="H4054"\w* Zebulun.
So the Israelites gave \w to|strong="H6932"\w* the Levites these cities \w and|strong="H4054"\w* their \w pasturelands|strong="H4054"\w*.

They assigned by lot \w the|strong="H1410"\w* cities named above \w from|strong="H4294"\w* \w the|strong="H1410"\w* \w tribes|strong="H4294"\w* \w of|strong="H4294"\w* Judah, Simeon, \w and|strong="H4054"\w* Benjamin.

\w And|strong="H4054"\w* some \w of|strong="H4054"\w* \w the|strong="H3270"\w* clans \w of|strong="H4054"\w* \w the|strong="H3270"\w* Kohathites were given cities from \w the|strong="H3270"\w* tribe \w of|strong="H4054"\w* Ephraim for their territory:

They were given Shechem (a city of refuge)\f + \fr 6:67 \ft As in the parallel text at Joshua 21:21; Hebrew They were given the cities of refuge: Shechem\f* with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, and Gezer,
Jokmeam, Beth-horon,
Aijalon, and Gath-rimmon, together with their pasturelands.
And from the half-tribe of Manasseh the remaining clans of the Kohathites were given Aner and Bileam, together with their pasturelands.
The Gershomites received the following: From the clan of the half-tribe of Manasseh they were given Golan in Bashan and also Ashtaroth, together with their pasturelands.
From the tribe of Issachar they were given Kedesh, Daberath,
Ramoth, and Anem, together with their pasturelands.
From the tribe of Asher they were given Mashal, Abdon,
Hukok, and Rehob, together with their pasturelands.
And from the tribe of Naphtali they were given Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon, and Kiriathaim, together with their pasturelands.

The Merarites (the rest of the Levites) received the following: From the tribe of Zebulun they were given Rimmono and Tabor,\f + \fr 6:77 \ft LXX (they were given) Jokneam, Kartah, Rimmono, and Tabor; see Joshua 21:34.\f* together with their pasturelands.
From the tribe of Reuben east of the Jordan opposite Jericho they were given Bezer in the wilderness, Jahzah,\f + \fr 6:78 \ft Jahzah is a variant of Jahaz; see Numbers 21:23.\f*
Kedemoth, and Mephaath, together with their pasturelands.
And from the tribe of Gad they were given Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim,
Heshbon, and Jazer, together with their pasturelands.
